review: The good - low low cost. Gets you netflix, AIV. Hulu, youtube, slingtv. The bad - not as many content choices as roku. And store is limited compared to apple or google ecosystem.Updating review - note that I purchased this device for travel. I also have a fire tv that I have been playing with as well so this review applies equally unless stated.For both, the content available is just not as wide as for roku, apple, google. With that said, the most important content is available for streaming. Voice search not as good as google's. Cast support is partial (no mirroring). I have not been able to get hdhomerun to work with the big firetv (or the stick). And I have not been able to find any tablo support. Both device also feel sluggish in the UI compared to roku/apple (getting my new shield today so will be testing that next). And have seen some video frame drops on both devices when watching 1080p netflix.Between the firetv stick and firetv, I would definitely recommend the stick. Neither device can really play games very well which relagates them both to streamers. And when looking at streaming, the stick pretty much does everything the normal fire tv does.Firetv does not have a wide enough/flexible enough content ecosystem to make it into a cord-cutting solution for me but it is a solid streamer (roku is closer to working as a cord-cutting solution and I'll be installing/testing nvidia shield shortly). And the cost is extremely low.And if you do purchase this for travel, a word of warning. Most hotel TVs block off access to hdmi ports :(
